data:
Here is the breakdown of potential risks associated with the PREVENT-IA product, categorized and classified as High, Medium, Low, or Discarded, along with a mitigation plan for each classified risk:

**Risks**

| Risk | Category | Classification | Mitigation Plan |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Negative public opinion on the use of AI | Reputation | High | 1. Conduct thorough market research to understand public concerns about AI. 2. Develop a clear and transparent communication strategy to address these concerns. 3. Engage with stakeholders and experts to build trust and credibility. |
| Energy consumption | Environmental | Medium | 1. Optimize the platform's architecture to reduce energy consumption. 2. Use energy-efficient cloud services. 3. Implement a monitoring system to track energy consumption. |
| Dependence on AI model providers | Technology | Medium | 1. Develop a diversified AI model provider strategy. 2. Implement a backup and disaster recovery plan. 3. Monitor AI model provider performance and adapt to changes. |
| Unfriendly interfaces | User Experience | Medium | 1. Conduct user testing and feedback sessions to improve the interface. 2. Develop a user-centered design approach. 3. Provide training and support for users. |
| Lack of feedback | User Experience | Medium | 1. Implement a feedback mechanism for users. 2. Analyze and act on user feedback. 3. Provide regular updates and improvements based on feedback. |
| Poor prioritization of functionalities | Development | Medium | 1. Conduct a thorough analysis of user needs and requirements. 2. Prioritize functionalities based on user feedback and business goals. 3. Implement a agile development approach to ensure iterative improvement. |
| Low visibility on social media | Marketing | Low | 1. Develop a social media marketing strategy. 2. Create engaging content and campaigns. 3. Monitor and adapt to social media trends and changes. |
| Difficulty in measuring training quality | Evaluation | Medium | 1. Develop a clear and measurable evaluation framework. 2. Implement a monitoring system to track training quality. 3. Analyze and act on evaluation results. |
| AI use regulations | Legal | High | 1. Conduct thorough research on AI use regulations. 2. Comply with relevant regulations and standards. 3. Monitor changes in regulations and adapt to new requirements. |
| Other risks (e.g. lack of training, inadequate infrastructure) | Various | Low | 1. Develop a comprehensive training program for users. 2. Ensure adequate infrastructure and resources. 3. Monitor and adapt to changes and challenges. |

Note: The classification of risks as High, Medium, Low, or Discarded is subjective and may vary depending on the specific context and priorities of the project.
